I have a dog-eared old paperback "Japanese Inn" by Oliver 
Staler about the Mochizuke family, starting with a sixteenth 
century samurai in the service of the Takeda who has his 
'castle' (a salt-store? there's no garrison) burnt down by 
Tokugawa Ieyasu (I think) and is reduced to inn-keeping.

Interesting because it refers to Will Adams, and that he and 
Tokugawa Ieyasu spent many a pleasant afternoon talking 
in the garden.

Tom
